column1: Bavette's Bar & Boeuf////ORIGINAL - As far as food goes
column2: I'd recommend give it a try. However
column3: keep an eye on your credit card bill. They changed my tip
column4: and I was charged $78 on the tip for a $90 meal (including $9 tax). Granted I rarely dine at this kind of restaurant
column5: so I just wrote a normal 20% tip on the check
column6: and my US friends always tell me I don't necessarily have to include tax when calculating the tip. I was dining quietly alone
column7: and all service I asked for was food
column9: and an extra seasoned salt. It was my first trip to Chicago
column10: and this dining experience is definitely the "highlight" of the trip.
